title: For Sale:  Large Custom Bowie Knife
postcontent: This is a one of a kind bowie knife. I know because I made it. Its blade is over 12" and made of A2 (look it up) steel tempered to 60 Rockwell. Sharpened to a shaving edge (really you could shave yourself with this knife). The handle is African Black wood. A very dense hard wood that takes a great polish. The bolster and hilt are brass that has been allowed to attain its own unique patina. Comes with a full grain cowhide case. Chops like a machete or slices a tomato.  These knives were back up to pistols in the day when pistols were not all that reliable. They could do limb amputations with one terrible blow. What a great conversational piece or take it camping. You could be the owner for only 380 dollars.  Better than factory knives costing much more.

title: For Sale:  Winchester Ranger Bonded 40 S&W Hollowpoint Ammunition in 50 Round Law Enforcement Boxes
postcontent:
We have some 165 Grain 40 S&W Winchester Ranger Bonded Law Enforcement ammunition to offer you today. This bullet, in the 180 grain offering, was selected by the FBI as their duty cartridge. This 165 grain load is about 150 feet per second faster and is the choice of many police agencies. This bullet reliably expands to 7/10 of an inch and the advertised muzzle velocity is 1140 feet per second resulting in 476 foot pounds of energy. This is roughly the speed of most 124 grain 9mm standard pressure cartridges.

Winchester sells this to civilians under the brand "PDX1 Bonded". You can find it sometimes at WalMart or your local gun shop. It is offered to civilians in 20 round fancy plastic boxes. MidwayUSA sells a 20 round box for $23.99, plus shipping.

Here, in Spring Hill, you can buy a box of 50 rounds for $25. This is first quality Law Enforcement ammunition and you can get it for half the price of some retailers. Available for delivery in Spring Hill, TN. Please contact if you are interested.

postcontent:
Once again---sorry for the lousy pictures but I would rather spend my spare bucks on firearms than camera gear. If you need more photos, please PM your e-mail and be specific with asking what you want to see. I don't do pay-pal but gladly accept cash or MO's, and maybe even a check if you ask, and your reputation on this site is acceptable. I have no idea what some of these will fit. If you know, please share it with all of us by posting it. I will also combine items for shipping and pass along some savings if/when I can.

1) Lawrence 1C #585. I have been notified by a forum member that this is for a Beretta .25 Bantam. $35 Shipped


2) Bianchi marked S&W#5B MP. This one is nicely broken in but in great shape. This one is for is for a S&W 2" M&P. $35 Shipped


3) SOLD
4) SOLD
5) SOLD

6) The only markings on this is a stamped 160. One of the snaps is marked Schoellkopf Jumbo---I have never heard of them but maybe you have??? The snap on the retention strap needs to be replaced, other than this is seems to be a heavy duty holster with lots of life left in it. I tried a 4" Security six and it is too short. I tried a 6" Security six and it hangs out just a hair. $25 Shipped


7) Pair of cheap plastic factory Glock belt slides. These are well used and one has a custom repair with leather where the plastic belt loop broke. These might just be perfect for a creative idea like strapping one on the steering column??? $10 Shipped for the pair.


8) SOLD
9) SOLD
10) SOLD
11) SOLD


12) Roys Leather Goods 27-28. This is another very well made holster in great condition. The snap on the retention strap needs to be replaced. I don't know what this was intended to fit but my 4" Security six fits in it like a glove. $35 Shipped


13) SOLD

14) Unknown maker stamped 4 68 6 on the back. Decent old holster with 2 snaps on the retention strap for adjustable length. I have no idea what might live in this one, but if I were to guess I would say an old pencil barrel 6" S&W of some sort. $15 Shipped


15) Frisbie Leather, Portland, Oregon is the only markings on this one. Again old school vell made holster in pretty nice shape. I am guessing this was made for a S&W, but it fits my 6" Security six just fine. $30 Shipped


16) Safety Speed Holster stamped 38 and 4 which I would guess back in the day meant 38 caliber and 4". I think I just saw officers Reed and Malloy on Adam 12 carrying this same holster. This one has definitely been around the block a time or 2. If you collect old cop stuff you will probably should add this to the collection. $20 Shipped


17) Uncle Mikes size 5 adjustable flap holster. This is a lefty with velcro on one side of the flap. This allows you to adjust how far up or down the flap will be depending on what you have in it. It says size 5 if this helps. My 4" Security six fits pretty low in it, and my 6" Security six is a bit long for it. I would guess a 5 inch barrel would be a perfect fit. $20 Shipped


18) Ted Blocker Leather. I don't know if this is for a flashlight, baton, or mace can. Used buy certainly has plenty of life left in it. $10 Shipped


19) Owners manual for a European American Armory Corp, Model witness P semi automatic pistol. I just hate tossing this sort of thing in the trash. If you can use it let me know.

STEAL IT DEAL----Items 6, 7, 12, 14, 15, 16, 17, and 18. I can get this all into a flat rate box for $55 Shipped.

title: For Sale:  BNIB LEFT HANDED TAVOR
postcontent: The dynamics of the battlefield are forever changing. With the increasing threat of terrorism in our streets to the evolving situations of combat applications, a new paradigm in firearms was required. In 1982, with the foresight of what the modern battlefield was becoming, IWI in a decade long collaboration with the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) Research & Development teams, developed the new standard issue weapon for the IDF. The TAVOR® was born. Mr. Zalman Shebs, known as the “father of the TAVOR,” spearheaded the team to develop a weapon system that was capable of moving from open field conflicts to close-quarter engagements and from daylight to nighttime capabilities – seamlessly on a single mission. In the late 1990’s through the early 2000’s, the TAVOR underwent unprecedented testing unlike any weapons system anywhere. The TAVOR began trials with IDF units testing for ergonomics. The TAVOR then entered the IDF NCO Infantry School for extensive field tests and finally, in 2002, the TAVOR was given to an army company in the Givati Brigade for real-world testing and use. By September, 2003, the IDF had chosen the TAVOR rifle as the standard issue for their infantry troops. Today the TAVOR rifles are in service with IDF Infantry troops and the IDF Special Forces in Israel along with many military and law enforcement agencies around the world. IWI and IWI US have brought the same dedication of craft and commitment to performance and reliability to the American customer with the TAVOR SAR rifle. TAVOR® SAR Features Include:Bullpup configuration allows for short rifle convenience with long rifle accuracyOptimized ergonomic design for increased comfort and ease-of-useClean, long stroke gas piston operation5.56 NATO detachable, cold hammer-forged barrel (CHF), chrome-lined with 1:7 twist, CrMoV steelOptional 9mm Parabellum conversion kit with CHF barrel, 1:10 twist, CrMoV steel100% ambidextrous configuration and operation with optional left-hand bolts for 5.56 NATO. No additional parts required to convert 9mm Parabellum to LH configurationIntegral ambidextrous front and rear quick detachable sling swivel receptacles with push button swivelsSimple field stripping into easily serviceable subassembliesMil-Std 100% interchangeability of all TAVOR SAR partsLast round - bolt holds open on an empty magazineAll metal parts treated for corrosion resistanceIntegral rubber recoil pad

title: For Sale:  Sig Sauer P226: Herndon, VA, Triple Serialized, West German Mfg
location: Portsmouth to Rochester, New Hampshire, United States
postcontent:
Good afternoon,

  Out of my safe and personal collection: I have a Sig Sauer P226 DA/SA in 9mm.  This is an old school P226 that is all original.  It was imported through Herndon, VA: pre-Exeter, NH days.

  It was manufactured in WEST Germany and has the original style checkered grips.  This was made back in the days when all the parts were machined - not MIM.  And also when they were hand fitted - not mass produced on an assembly line.

  It has the original yellow, red velvet lined box.  Original manual.  Original hang tag.  Original zipper back magazine.  Original test target.  The S/Ns match on everything: slide, barrel, frame, box and target.

  The gun has been fired, but I would rate it at 97% plus condition.  These are nearly impossible to find in this condition anymore.

  Regardless of whether you have a NH pistol permit or not, this pistol MUST be transferred through an FFL dealer.  No exceptions.

  Thanks for looking and have a great day.

title: For Sale:  Pre Ban Steyr AUG A1 16" & 24" HBAR LE A2 A3 USR
location: Fort Walton Beach, Florida, United States
postcontent:
Where do I start! Super rare,super collectible Steyr package! This may not be a "Once in a Lifetime" deal but it's close! This listing is for a Black Pre Ban Steyr AUG A1 with a 16" barrel. I believe only two thousand or so of this model were imported for LE and Military. The chamber,receiver and barrel all have matching #s starting with the 906 prefix. ( I have not disassembled the rifle to check any other numbers)The only real flaw this AUG has is the top of the scope is missing some of the finish.The optic itself is good and clear.Now for the kicker! Also included in this listing is the super rare 24" HBAR barrel with factory bipod.(Only 350 or so ever imported!)I bought the HBAR barrel from the original owner that had put only 20 rounds through it. The bore is perfect as well as the bore on the 16" barrel. The only flaws on the 24" barrel is where the bipod folds up and puts wear marks on the finish of the barrel. The 24" barrel is marked 5.56/7"and the bipod legs have 5 height settings. Also included is a soft case and one new Steyr 30rd. mag. Please feel free to ask any questions you might have. I answer emails daily. Shipping will be $50. I will ship the rifle in the soft case to the FFL and I will ship the 24" HBAR barrel directly to the buyer.

These are out of my "Personal Collection" I have had both for years. I have never even put a round through the 24" barrel. I hate to sell these but,I'm trying to raise funds for a classic car project. These will surely continue to go up in value! I will not seperate the 24" barrel from the package. Either it all goes or it all stays. Thanks.

Where do I start! Super rare,super collectible Steyr package! This may not be a "Once in a Lifetime" deal but it's close! This listing is for a Black Pre Ban Steyr AUG A1 with a 16" barrel. I believe only two thousand or so of this model were imported for LE and Military. The chamber,receiver and barrel all have matching #s starting with the 906 prefix. ( I have not disassembled the rifle to check any other numbers)The only real flaw this AUG has is the top of the scope is missing some of the finish.The optic itself is good and clear.Now for the kicker! Also included in this listing is the super rare 24" HBAR barrel with factory bipod.(Only 350 or so ever imported!)I bought the HBAR barrel from the original owner that had put only 20 rounds through it. The bore is perfect as well as the bore on the 16" barrel. The only flaws on the 24" barrel is where the bipod folds up and puts wear marks on the finish of the barrel. The 24" barrel is marked 5.56/7"and the bipod legs have 5 height settings. Also included is a soft case and one new Steyr 30rd. mag. Please feel free to ask any questions you might have. I answer emails daily. Shipping will be $50. I will ship the rifle in the soft case to the FFL and I will ship the 24" HBAR barrel directly to the buyer.

These are out of my "Personal Collection" I have had both for years. I have never even put a round through the 24" barrel. I hate to sell these but,I'm trying to raise funds for a classic car project. These will surely continue to go up in value! I will not seperate the 24" barrel from the package. title: For Sale:  Duluth Gun Show
postcontent:
Hello,for those that are going to show I thought I list what im bringing to sell and trade since ill be up there. Ill also list what im looking for and what im interested in. If you see something you like,give me a call and lets work something out. I will only trade firearms for firearms and cash is king of course. I do not want a VCR, your leaky broken boat,motorcycle,your broke car and ect. I'm a private seller and also have my permit to carry. I don't have a table set up,just will be walking around. 

Weston
6 Five One - 9 Zero Zero - Two 8 Six 5.

-What I have for sale and trade. All rifles are in their original configuration unless stated otherwise. I will state if the rifle comes with something in the post next to it. If I don't state anything with it,than its just the rifle.
-Hungarian 91/30. Really minty,no import marks, good bore,Arabic stock painting numbers,never shot this rifle myself. Everything matches except the end plate. $750
-Hungarian M44. In ok to good condition overall,has a ok to good bore. Cant remember off the top of my head if its matching. This is actually a really good shooter also. $250
-Gew 88 made in 1891 at Loewe,updated to modern 8mm Mauser,has a Turk bolt but I have not noticed any other Turk stamping on it. Trigger and bore on this are amazing. Shows signs of use but this rifle was made in 1891 folks. $325
-Finnish M28/76 "no date" with built in scope mount and aftermarket rail. This rifle is in 7.62x53r and is amazing. The Finns sure do know how to build rifles. Great and mirror like bore and of course a two-stage trigger. With the aftermarket rail,$750
-Finnish M28 "ski trooper" version. Great bore,great two stage trigger,and is very accurate. $500
-x2 Tula Mosin Nagant 91/30 Ex sniper PE&PEM rifles. Both in great shape and I think the ex PE side mount rifle is all matching. One is a side mount PE,and the other is a double date,top mount PEM sniper rifle with a bent bolt. I also have a real 1938 Progress PEM scope with an Accumount top mount for it. I wanted to make the double date ex sniper back to her former glory with it but it just got pushed back. $275 for the ex side mount sniper rifle,and $375 for the double date ex PEM top mount rifle with a bent bolt. PEM scope with mount $700.
-PTR PDW .308 pistol. 8.5 in barrel,bought it brand new,turns heads at the range with it. In great shape also. Comes with PTR hard case,2 HK mags,HK cleaning kit,and mag pouch. $850.


-What I will trade for. I do not like "sporterzied" or chopped up firearms. Im also not interested in hunting rifles or hunting shotguns. Please dont offer those to me.
-Police issued revolvers,shotguns,AR-15s,and ect. Really looking for a Minnesota police issued firearm.
-S&W Model 29. Not a 629,just a Model 29.
-Certain SKS rifles. Looking for ones that can take AK mags,Yugo M59s,Yugo M59 ex sniper rifle or one with the scope base still,Yugo SKS rifles with the factory full auto stock,Yugo 30rd SKS mag,Certain Russian SKS rifles,East German SKS,N. Korean,N. Vietnam,SKS bring backs WITH PAPER WORK to prove it,and Romanian SKS rifles.
-Certain Mosin Nagant rifles. If you have not noticed from above,I collect these rifles and im only looking for rare and interesting ones. If you have a standard 91/30,M44,or a common year M38 I wont be interested in it unless its cheap,just being honest folks.
-AK rifles. I love AKs and AK style rifles. Really would like a Tabuk rifle,PSL,M76,Chinese Type 56,,and ect. As long as its original,not beat up,not a .22 version,not a WASR,not a single stacked AK,ill be interested in it.
-AR rifles. Not interested in AR-15s,they're boring to me. Only AR rifles im looking for are,RR LAR-47.CMMG mutant,select AR-10s(nothing modern or anything DPMS),and im looking for a CMMG mutant lower or a CMMG lower that takes G3 mags. If you have an AR and its not what I listed above,I wont be interested in it. 
-SVT-40 rifles. If the bore or the gas port looks bad,frosted,rusty,and ect im not interested in it unless its really really cheap.
-Suomi M31 semi auto rifles. 
-TT-30's and TT-33 pistols. Not interested in a Romanian TT-33 unless its cheap.
-German WWI and WWII pistols. Looking for "shooters" C96s and Lugers. Dont need a museum piece but i don't want a beat to death one. Also looking for a Chinese .45 cal C96.
-Firearms with bring back paper work. It has the legit paper work im interested.
-Surplus rifles and pistols. I pretty much like anything from the 1890's to 1970's as far as surplus firearms goes. Like how I want a WWI Colt .45 pistol or would love to have a Colt M16A1 parts kit to build or a Swiss K31. If its a surplus firearm,you have a better chance of me liking it more than any AR rifles towards trading at least.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Customized Glock 17 Gen II
location: Dadeville but travel frequently, Alabama, United States
postcontent:
I took this weapon in on trade thinking it would be the perfect truck or backpacking gun....but she has sat in the safe since so now its time for something else. 

She started her life as a Glock 17 gen 2 made in the early 90's, in the past a owner polished the slide and internals (nobody likes a chrome glock but I digress) and the owner before me decided to use an at home cerakote kit (the coverage is acceptable but by no means professional). Factory night sights, extended slide release, all she needs is your ammo and love. 

I fired 200 rounds of factory ammo and a few hand loads through the weapon with no problem or failures. The stippling although not visual pleasing is extremely "grippy" and makes an excellent grip surface for sweaty palms.

the weapon covers both worlds of accuracy from the G17 barrel and concealment from the G19 grip length. 

I will include two G17 mags and 1 G19 mags with this weapon and can probably round up a generic glock box if you need one.

title: For Sale:  German GECO LP-2 GUN SIGHT
postcontent: All sales are final. THE GUN IS NOT INCLUDED! This listing is for 1 FLARE GUN SIGHT (Patent pending.) The Black SIGHT in the picture. They come in Black, Orange, and Pink. I know you ladies have your particular shades of pink that you like so if you need a color picture example or you're looking for a specific color just let me know.There are currently Two versions for this listing, The Flat Top Version, or The Tactical Version. (Tactical version is the one with the rail on it) Custom modifications also available. The Flat Top Version was designed to allow the user to still be able to holster your flare gun. This sight gives you the ability to aim your flare gun when using a sub caliber insert. Such as the .22 sub caliber insert or the 45LC/410 sub caliber insert as well as many others available on the market today. This sight only works on the 26.5 mm German GECO LP-2flare gun. ( The one shown in the pictures) Each one is custom-made and designed to specifically fit this particular GECO LP-2 flare gun and they are not interchangeable. For example the German GECO LP-2 will not fit on a polish ext. I have other sights as well as other accessories for the sights, including various carbon fiber models available in a separate listing. You will receive the flare gun sight and the standard Hardware kit, you may also purchase other accessories separately.The flare guns and the flashlight, flashlight mount, laser sight and bipod are not for sale. They are props for demonstration purposes only. All sales are final! Buyer assumes all legal and moral responsibilities if any. All sales shall be subject to and governed by Wisconsin law. Jurisdiction and venue shall be the state of Wisconsin, Milwaukee County. Side Note: The lower rail for the sight we offer are as low as $20 with shipping when combined with any other purchase! You can also purchase a Blackout Hardware Kit shown in the photos for an additional $5.99 with any other purchase, otherwise Blackout Hardware Kit sold separately for $8.99. Add aSight aperture coloring service as suggested in the photo for $5.99 with any sight purchase. Lower rail with 2 ammo caddys Coming soon!  Lower Rail as low as. $20.00 Blackout Hardware Kit as low as. $5.99 Sight coloring service as suggested in the photo . $5.99 lower rail / ammo caddy as low as. $24.99 Coming soon! Please contact me if you have questions.How to order: Please specify the color (Black, Orange, or Pink) and the version, (Flat Top Version, or The Tactical) when ordering. You may place a note on the PayPal order form when paying or send me a separate email. You may copy and paste the selection below. Type, LP-2 Color ___________Version___________ If we do not hear from you within 10 days of payment are most popular sight will be sent. Payment, If you like I can send you a PayPal invoice and you can pay with credit or debit. Or if you prefer a cashier's check or money order I accept those as well. Please send cashier's check or money order to: Sparks Trust PO Box 342441 Milwaukee, WI 53234 With the following information. Your name and contact information including telephone number or email address, The Address where you would like your item to be sent. Which item you want. Please contact me if you have questions. Please note: All sales are final. This is a brand new product (Patent pending.) They are constantly being updated and revised, based on the overwhelming positive response we have gotten from people just like you. There may be some cosmetic flaws, however will be 100% functional. This product is 100% manufactured in the USA and all sales are final! Bulk order discounts available and free shipping on bulk orders only. Bulk orders discount start at 5 items!Shipping:$5.00 USPS first class shipping $8.99 USPS flat rate small box, to the lower 48$19.99 USPS first class shipping for international shipping. We do ship worldwide. If you have a confirmed PayPal address, then yes, we do ship to your area. Worldwide shipping is the same price on 1 to 5 items. You will have tracking and delivery confirmation Worldwide, and in some cases you may be asked and/or required to have signature confirmation. In some cases may add to your shipping cost. It may take up to 3 weeks to Ship and/or take delivery of your product, because they are produced to order typically. Very rarely would it take 3 weeks, but just to be up front with you, and just keep in mind, I will not rush a junk product out the door just to meet your deadline. Typically within 7 to 10 business days. For Pay Pal people this will ship to the verified address through Pay Pal especially on Worldwide shipping. Please contact me if you have questions. Please note and understand,It is your responsibility as the buyer to know your local laws and ordinances. All sales are final and I am NOT responsible for Customs Caesars or delays. Thank you for understanding and your cooperation. Returns and exchanges: All sales are final. If for some reason you are unhappy or unsatisfied. You may exchange it for a replacement item or alternate version, one time. Shipping is at buyers expense. If for some reason you receive a defective product, you may exchange it for a replacement item. Defective meaning the item is unusable. Return shipping is at buyers expense. In order to participate in returns and/or exchanges photographs will be necessary and we must receive the defective or returned alternate item prior to shipping out your new item. You also must contact us for further details and accompany your return/exchange item with the following information. Your name, contact information including telephone number and email address, AL ID, Date of Payment, Your Return Address (where you would like your new item to be sent.) and which item you are exchanging (name of product you are sending), and which item you want (the name of the item you want us to send back to you.) Please contact me if you have questions. And thank you for supporting a made in America product.Some things to consider when purchasing from Sparks Trust:First we would like to thank you for coming down this far and reading this entire ad in its entirety. With crowdfunding being very popular nowadays, we doubt that we would be able to meet the $15k goal in the time allotted. Not to mention many of those places take a fee off the top.We decided to start selling the flare gun sights on several websites in order to generate funds for this ongoing project. The flare guns sites have gone through thousands of changes, tweaks and upgrades over the past 18 months. They have gone from a concept stage all the way through to a work of art in addition to its obvious functionality. We have also implemented additional accessories for the sight including the lower rail and a new ammo caddy. The lower rail was designed to allow the user to attach a laser or flashlight to the bottom of the flare gun. The ammo caddy will allow those same features, in addition to holding additional ammo at your fingertips.There are also other features and accessories I would like to bring to the market, however financing is a big challenge not only for this project but for several other projects and innovations to the firearms industry.By purchasing a flare gun sight you are helping to fund these projects. Donations are also accepted to further the projects. We appreciate and value every sale, every customer and every donation.The next big innovative project we would like to bring to the firearms industry is The Double Standard. We do have a Patent Pending. Do you own a firearm that only comes with one size of magazine? Do only some of the magazines you have work flawlessly?The Double Standard is a magazine adapter that allows the user to take two standard capacity magazines and turn it into one higher capacity magazine. So many firearms on the market today only come in one size of magazine. You couldn't buy another size even if you wanted to. For instance, the Ruger SR22 only comes in a 10-round magazine. The Sig Sauer Mosquito, The Walther P22 and the tt-33 series only come in 8 or 9 round magazine capacity. The Romanian PSL has a lot of magazine seating problems, as well as the magazines themselves are ridiculously expensive. The Double Standard eliminates the problems associated with magazine seating correctly as well as provides you with additional ammunition for your firearm. PRE ORDER OPPORTUNITYThe retail price on this will be approximately $27. If you pre-order you will get 2 for this price. We have secured the patents. We are past the proof of concept and functionality stage. Now we just need the funding to procure manufacturing for this product. Will you help take part in The Double Standard change?Please contact me for additional information.Thank you, Sparks Trust Arms Research and Restoration.

It's no wonder the 85s are our most popular family. We pack them with a combination of customer-requested features and pair them with the .38 Special +P ammo making them powerful, easy to carry and lightning-quick to use. To many of our friends in Law Enforcement, these are must-have revolvers.Plus PPlus P rated for duty use. This firearm is designed to handle high pressure loads under SAAMI specifications.Taurus Security System (TSS)rsTaurus family of semi-auto pistols all feature the Taurus Security System, which provides instant-ready defense with built-in ability to secure your pistol and make it inoperable at the turn of a key. When the Security System is engaged, the pistol cannot be fired or cocked and the gun's manual safety cannot be disengaged. As with our revolver Security System, the device is part of the firearm and cannot be lost, and the same special Security Key works for both the revolver and pistol Systems (two keys come with each gun). To engage: simply insert the Key into the button on the rear or side of the pistol and rotate one-quarter turn clockwise. This engages the Security System. The manual safety cannot be moved and the trigger cannot be pulled. To disengage: simply rotate the key one-quarter turn back.
